pr_title: Create issue if nightly build fails

timeline.message: Create issue if nightly build fails

timeline.bodyText: Is it only possible to assign one person to assignee? If not, maybe can assign the team if it's possible, or otherwise the manually maintained list of the maintainers if that's possible. Otherwise... thanks! ;)
timeline.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: Several assignees can be defined. Don't know about a team. I am OK for now with being single assignee or I can add you and @trask, if you want :)
replies.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: I can't speak for @trask but go ahead and add me :)
replies.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: does it need an assignee? or can we have no assignee, and then whichever one of us picks it up can assign ourselves so we don't duplicate effort fixing
replies.author: trask

replies.bodyText: I propose to leave it as it is, assigning to me (it will help me react faster), but you are more than welcomed to steal these issue from me if you reach them earlier :)
replies.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: that works for me, what time does the nightly build run, and should we optimize that timing for you?
replies.author: trask

replies.bodyText: 03:24 UTC. That is usual nightly time for me :) So both you and Anuraag can grab it immediately, or I will wake up and deal with it.
replies.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText:
or I will wake up and deal with it

please don't 😄
and feel free to move the timing of the nightly build any time you want
replies.author: trask

replies.bodyText: I mean "wake up in my usual time in the morning and will deal with it in a due course during my work day" :)
replies.author: iNikem

timeline.author: anuraaga
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -97,3 +97,20 @@ jobs:
 
       - name: Test with Gradle
         run: ./gradlew latestDepTest
+
+  issue:
+    name: Open issue on failure
+    needs: [test, testLatestDep]
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

replies.bodyText: Don't know actually. Just copy-paste from examples and it's the same as in all other jobs. Is it important?
replies.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: My impression is JavaScript will work faster than docker but that's it so it's not too important.
replies.author: anuraaga
